title: Template-driven Forms
subject: Angular
theory: Template-driven forms rely on directives in the template to create and manipulate the underlying object model. They are suitable for simple forms.

examples.explanation: #loginForm exported as ngForm allows access to form status (valid/invalid) and values.

common_mistakes.correction: When using ngModel in a form tag, the name attribute is mandatory.
common_mistakes.example: Error: If ngModel is used within a form tag, either the name attribute must be set or the form control must be defined as 'standalone'.

interview_questions.question: What is ngModelGroup?
interview_questions.answer: It allows grouping of form controls within a form to create a nested object structure in the value output.

real_world_use_cases.description: A single input search bar doesn't need the complexity of Reactive Forms.

exam_notes: Validation is done via HTML attributes (required, minlength).
summary: Template-driven forms offer a quick way to setup forms using familiar 2-way binding concepts.
